newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Boral sees lower first half profits.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Boral sees lower first half profits.

text.p: Building materials and energy group Boral Ltd said on Thursday it expected first half profits in 1996/97 would be lower than the previous year's first half and that it expected to invest A$100 million in Asia in the current 1996/97 year.
"The first half will be challenging and we're expecting it (profits) to be below the corresponding half last year," Boral Managing Director Tony Berg told reporters.
"However, our July and August results indicated that the current rates of profitability are running well ahead of the monthly rates in the last half (of 1995/96)," Berg said.
"We're targeting about A$100 million of investment into Asia this year, that's growth," he said.
Boral Chairman Peter Cottrell said it was hard to forecast when the company would return to its trend of paying higher dividends.
